Name: coke production, dry quenching | benzene | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/191:Manufacture of coke oven products/1910:Manufacture of coke oven products
Description: Dry quenching is an alternative method of cooling hot coke in the coke production process. Instead of using water, the hot coke is rapidly cooled by circulating an inert gas, such as nitrogen or recycled flue gas, in a sealed chamber. Dry quenching offers benefits such as improved energy efficiency, reduced water consumption, minimized emissions, and enhanced coke quality. It allows for higher production rates, reduces the risk of coke breakage, and is particularly suitable for larger-scale coke plants.
